comparison.name: $gt
comparison.description: Matches values that are greater than the value specified in the query.

comparison.name: $gte
comparison.description: Matches values that are equal to or greater than the value specified in the query.

comparison.name: $in
comparison.description: Matches any of the values that exist in an array specified in the query.

comparison.name: $lt
comparison.description: Matches values that are less than the value specified in the query.

comparison.name: $lte
comparison.description: Matches values that are less than or equal to the value specified in the query.

comparison.name: $ne
comparison.description: Matches all values that are not equal to the value specified in the query.

comparison.name: $nin
comparison.description: Matches values that do not exist in an array specified to the query.

logical.name: $or
logical.description: Joins query clauses with a logical OR returns all documents that match the conditions of either clause.

logical.name: $and
logical.description: Joins query clauses with a logical AND returns all documents that match the conditions of both clauses.

logical.name: $not
logical.description: Inverts the effect of a query expression and returns documents that do not match the query expression.

logical.name: $nor
logical.description: Joins query clauses with a logical NOR returns all documents that fail to match both clauses.

element.name: $exists
element.description: Matches documents that have the specified field.

element.name: $type
element.description: Selects documents if a field is of the specified type.

evaluation.name: $mod
evaluation.description: Performs a modulo operation on the value of a field and selects documents with a specified result.

evaluation.name: $regex
evaluation.description: Selects documents where values match a specified regular expression.

evaluation.name: $where
evaluation.description: Matches documents that satisfy a JavaScript expression.

geospatial.name: $geoWithin
geospatial.description: Selects geometries within a bounding GeoJSON geometry.

geospatial.name: $geoIntersects
geospatial.description: Selects geometries that intersect with a GeoJSON geometry.

geospatial.name: $near
geospatial.description: Returns geospatial objects in proximity to a point.

geospatial.name: $nearSphere
geospatial.description: Returns geospatial objects in proximity to a point on a sphere.

array.name: $all
array.description: Matches arrays that contain all elements specified in the query.

array.name: $elemMatch
array.description: Selects documents if element in the array field matches all the specified $elemMatch condition.

array.name: $size
array.description: Selects documents if the array field is a specified size.

projection-operators.description: Projects the first element in an array that matches the query condition.

projection-operators.name: $elemMatch
projection-operators.description: Projects only the first element from an array that matches the specified $elemMatch condition.

projection-operators.name: $slice
projection-operators.description: Limits the number of elements projected from an array. Supports skip and limit slices.

fields.name: $inc
fields.description: Increments the value of the field by the specified amount.

fields.name: $setOnInsert
fields.description: Sets the value of a field upon documentation creation during an upsert. Has no effect on update operations that modify existing documents.

fields.name: $set
fields.description: Sets the value of a field in an existing document.

fields.name: $unset
fields.description: Removes the specified field from an existing document.

operators.description: Acts as a placeholder to update the first element that matches the query condition in an update.

operators.name: $addToSet
operators.description: Adds elements to an existing array only if they do not already exist in the set.

operators.name: $pop
operators.description: Removes the first or last item of an array.

operators.name: $pullAll
operators.description: Removes multiple values from an array.

operators.name: $pull
operators.description: Removes items from an array that match a query statement.

operators.name: $pushAll
operators.description: Deprecated. Adds several items to an array.

operators.name: $push
operators.description: Adds an item to an array.

modifiers.name: $each
modifiers.description: Modifies the $push and $addToSet operators to append multiple items for array updates.

modifiers.name: $slice
modifiers.description: Modifies the $push operator to limit the size of updated arrays.

modifiers.name: $sort
modifiers.description: Modifies the $push operator to reorder documents stored in an array.

bitwise.name: $bit
bitwise.description: Performs bitwise AND and OR updates of integer values.

isolation.name: $isolated
isolation.description: Modifies behavior of multi-updates to improve the isolation of the operation.

pipeline-operators.name: $project
pipeline-operators.description: Reshapes a document stream. $project can rename, add, or remove fields as well as create computed values and sub-documents.

pipeline-operators.name: $match
pipeline-operators.description: Filters the document stream, and only allows matching documents to pass into the next pipeline stage. $match uses standard MongoDB queries.

pipeline-operators.name: $limit
pipeline-operators.description: Restricts the number of documents in an aggregation pipeline.

pipeline-operators.name: $skip
pipeline-operators.description: Skips over a specified number of documents from the pipeline and returns the rest.

pipeline-operators.name: $unwind
pipeline-operators.description: Takes an array of documents and returns them as a stream of documents.

pipeline-operators.name: $group
pipeline-operators.description: Groups documents together for the purpose of calculating aggregate values based on a collection of documents.

pipeline-operators.name: $sort
pipeline-operators.description: Takes all input documents and returns them in a stream of sorted documents.

pipeline-operators.name: $geoNear
pipeline-operators.description: Returns an ordered stream of documents based on proximity to a geospatial point.

group-operators.name: $addToSet
group-operators.description: Returns an array of all the unique values for the selected field among for each document in that group.

group-operators.name: $first
group-operators.description: Returns the first value in a group.

group-operators.name: $last
group-operators.description: Returns the last value in a group.

group-operators.name: $max
group-operators.description: Returns the highest value in a group.

group-operators.name: $min
group-operators.description: Returns the lowest value in a group.

group-operators.name: $avg
group-operators.description: Returns an average of all the values in a group.

group-operators.name: $push
group-operators.description: Returns an array of all values for the selected field among for each document in that group.

group-operators.name: $sum
group-operators.description: Returns the sum of all the values in a group.

boolean-operators.name: $and
boolean-operators.description: Returns true only when all values in its input array are true.

boolean-operators.name: $or
boolean-operators.description: Returns true when any value in its input array are true.

boolean-operators.name: $not
boolean-operators.description: Returns the boolean value that is the opposite of the input value.

comparison-operators.name: $cmp
comparison-operators.description: Compares two values and returns the result of the comparison as an integer.

comparison-operators.name: $eq
comparison-operators.description: Takes two values and returns true if the values are equivalent.

comparison-operators.name: $gt
comparison-operators.description: Takes two values and returns true if the first is larger than the second.

comparison-operators.name: $gte
comparison-operators.description: Takes two values and returns true if the first is larger than or equal to the second.

comparison-operators.name: $lt
comparison-operators.description: Takes two values and returns true if the second value is larger than the first.

comparison-operators.name: $lte
comparison-operators.description: Takes two values and returns true if the second value is larger than or equal to the first.

comparison-operators.name: $ne
comparison-operators.description: Takes two values and returns true if the values are not equivalent.

arithmetic-operators.name: $add
arithmetic-operators.description: Computes the sum of an array of numbers.

arithmetic-operators.name: $divide
arithmetic-operators.description: Takes two numbers and divides the first number by the second.

arithmetic-operators.name: $mod
arithmetic-operators.description: Takes two numbers and calcualtes the modulo of the first number divided by the second.

arithmetic-operators.name: $multiply
arithmetic-operators.description: Computes the product of an array of numbers.

arithmetic-operators.name: $subtract
arithmetic-operators.description: Takes two numbers and subtracts the second number from the first.

string-operators.name: $strcasecmp
string-operators.description: Compares two strings and returns an integer that reflects the comparison.

string-operators.name: $substr
string-operators.description: Takes a string and returns portion of that string.

date-operators.name: $dayOfYear
date-operators.description: Converts a date to a number between 1 and 366.

date-operators.name: $dayOfMonth
date-operators.description: Converts a date to a number between 1 and 31.

date-operators.name: $dayOfWeek
date-operators.description: Converts a date to a number between 1 and 7.

date-operators.name: $year
date-operators.description: Converts a date to the full year.

date-operators.name: $month
date-operators.description: Converts a date into a number between 1 and 12.

date-operators.name: $week
date-operators.description: Converts a date into a number between 0 and 53

date-operators.name: $hour
date-operators.description: Converts a date into a number between 0 and 23.

date-operators.name: $minute
date-operators.description: Converts a date into a number between 0 and 59.

date-operators.name: $second
date-operators.description: Converts a date into a number between 0 and 59. May be 60 to account for leap seconds.

date-operators.name: $millisecond
date-operators.description: Returns the millisecond portion of a date as an integer between 0 and 999.

conditional-expressions.name: $cond
conditional-expressions.description: A ternary operator that evaluates one expression, and depending on the result returns the value of one following expressions.

conditional-expressions.name: $ifNull
conditional-expressions.description: Evaluates an expression and returns a value.

modifiers.name: $comment
modifiers.description: Adds a comment to the query to identify queries in the database profiler output.

modifiers.name: $explain
modifiers.description: Forces MongoDB to report on query execution plans. See explain().

modifiers.name: $hint
modifiers.description: Forces MongoDB to use a specific index. See hint()

modifiers.name: $maxScan
modifiers.description: Limits the number of documents a cursor will return for a query. See limit().

modifiers.name: $max
modifiers.description: Specifies a minimum exclusive upper limit for the index to use in a query. See max().

modifiers.name: $min
modifiers.description: Specifies a minimum inclusive lower limit for the index to use in a query. See min().

modifiers.name: $orderby
modifiers.description: Returns a cursor with documents sorted according to a sort specification. See sort().

modifiers.name: $returnKey
modifiers.description: Forces the cursor to only return fields included in the index.

modifiers.name: $showDiskLoc
modifiers.description: Modifies the documents returned to include references to the on-disk location of each document.

modifiers.name: $snapshot
modifiers.description: Forces the query to use the index on the _id field. See snapshot().

sort-order.name: $natural
sort-order.description: A special sort order that orders documents using the order of documents on disk.
